metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6866 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
slock allows attackers to bypass the screen lock via vectors involving an invalid password hash, which triggers a NULL pointer dereference and crash. It was discovered that slock incorrectly handled password hashes. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6866` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

suckless-tools - 42-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ratliff> for xenial and yakkety, the user must both disable pam and enable slock to be vulnerable

criterions.comment: suckless-tools package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '42-1').
